paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 variant K897T, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

patients.demographics: Proband (4 years old, male), mother (age not specified, female), father (age not specified, male)

individual_records.phenotype_details: Extreme prolongation of the QT interval, multiple episodes of ventricular arrhythmia.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient (proband) was diagnosed as a newborn with extreme prolongation of the QT interval on the surface electrocardiography (QTc of ∼825 ms) and experienced multiple episodes of ventricular arrhythmia called Torsades de pointe.
the mother was homozygous for the hERG polymorphism (Fig. 1 A, KCNH2_K897T+/+).
Neither parent was found to carry the Na+ channel mutation.

functional_data.summary: The KCNH2 polymorphism K897T was not found to influence the primary LQT-3 defect.

variants.segregation_data: The KCNH2 polymorphism segregates with the unaffected status in the mother.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on family segregation and functional studies.
variants.additional_notes: The KCNH2 variant K897T is common and has been previously studied in relation to arrhythmias.
key_quotes: the mother was homozygous for the hERG polymorphism (Fig. 1 A, KCNH2_K897T+/+).
The KCNH2 polymorphism K897T was not found to influence the primary LQT-3 defect.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant K897T was successfully extracted.
